He sits and watches when the clouds arise.
He went up to the hall and said.
"The autumn colors are bleak and clear.
It gets cooler in the morning and cooler in the evening.
I believe I know that moderation isn't forgiving.
A person who trains in the forest is on the path.
When he's hungry, he eats food.
When it's cold, they put on additional clothing.
They don't realize it.
The world is a place of suffering and pleasure.
How then do you know what's painful and pleasant?
He said.
'I only know that things pass before my eyes.
They don't realize that old age comes from the top of their heads.
Those who undertake the path open the fields and turn back.
He went up to the hall and said.
"I was three years old when I was working with cement in various districts.
He took his hoe and helped him with the plow.
When the barn is full, he collects rice and returns to the monastery.
As long as he lets Chan and Saṃgha go, he'll go to his belly.
Is this Seon or rice?
He then said.
'It's because the wind blows the fire.'
It doesn't use much energy.
He rose to the hall and said.
'Not a drop less will do.
Not a drop left over should be allowed.
"And what kind of person's share of the work is this?
After a long time, he said.
'Every day the sun goes up in the east.
Night after night, the moon flows west.
He ascended to the hall and said.
"The words are the same, but the speech is the same.
Their words are the same, and their speech is the same.
Their sounds and gestures are the same, and their expressions are the same.
Their principle and intent are the same.
Why is it that they say.
He's not here.
He then said.
It's just that his nostrils are big and his head is down.
Record of the Monk Baeg-un's Discourse, Volume 2
